FWIW, there are times when i am constrained to only use Atom/AtomPub,
but s=
till need to support ad-hoc queries (HTML.FORM@method=3D"get")
and/or write=
 operations with inline arguments
(HTML.FORM@method=3D"post").

in these ca=
ses, i usually use the Atom message as a "wrapper" for an
embedded payload =
based on XHTML. the representations are simply
slip-streamed into the atom:=
content element and the client is "taught"
to recognize, parse, and activat=
e hypermedia controls within the
atom:content element of an Atom response.
=

it's a hack, but it works well.
